About Nettitude
Founded in 2003, Nettitude is an award-winning global provider of cybersecurity services, bringing innovative thought leadership to the ever-evolving cybersecurity marketplace. Through our research and innovation centers, we provide threat led services that span technical assurance, consulting and managed detection and response offerings.
We are driven by a desire to build and deliver the best cybersecurity propositions in the industry and stay abreast of the evolving legislative and regulatory cybersecurity landscape. This helps our clients to prioritize their cybersecurity risks, enabling them to focus on the activities that are core to their business.
The role
Nettitude is currently going through a period of accelerated growth within our US office. We are looking to add multiple roles to the US Sales Team; one of these is an experienced Senior Account Executive to support our strategic client expansion. You will work with a large variety of industries and geographies.
For the US Sales team, the key objectives of the Senior Account Executive will be to:

Identify opportunity within Fortune 1000 Accounts with various outbound activities 
Develop a funnel of 40+ accounts with growth potential
Be responsible for the Sales to Delivery process; supported by the Project Delivery and Technical Teams

Nettitude will provide you with the training and support that will equip you with an understanding of the cyber security industry and Nettitude’s service offering. You will be required to acquire and own accounts and perform all activities during the sales cycle along with managing the client engagement throughout the project delivery cycle. Performance will be demonstrated by meeting/exceeding agreed upon Sales KPI’s.
As a member of Nettitude’s team you will provide a first-class service to ensure our clients are secure and protected. 
Location
Candidates must be eligible to work full time in the USA. Nettitude HQ for North America is in New York City, however remote workers may apply.
What you will be doing in your role
In your role you will:

Build a sales pipeline in line with sales targets set by Net New Business Team
Generate meetings with prospects through cold outreach and strategic Nettitude marketing activities 
Have the ability to identify opportunity across NALA with no restrictions on set geography or type of client
Develop and nurture a net new sales funnel through events, network type leads and outbound campaigns 
Construct and present tailored presentations/proposals to clients based on these requirements
Grow accounts from lucrative single/dual lines of business into multiple lines and high yield
Provide accurate forecasts to the Team Leader on weekly basis
Manage a complete sales cycle and support the project management/ technical teams to ensure seamless project delivery
Be expected to understand the competitive landscape and demonstrate Nettitude’s key value propositions
Work closely with both the Nettitude US Sales and Marketing team to build campaigns and enhance prospect/client meetings
Be prospecting, qualifying, closing (as part of your daily activities) and work closely with project and technical management support on closed deals
Create, Implement, and Execute on Strategic Account Plans
Conduct effective conversations with upper and executive information security levels

Key skills
You will need the following:

Proven professional services sales experience gained within the IT/Cyber Security sector
Demonstrable direct sales experience 
A track record of achieving quota year on year
Strong presentation skills and experience presenting to C-Suite
Comprehensive and current knowledge of company offerings and industry trends
The drive and energy to manage multiple accounts while looking for new opportunities
Proven track record of success prospecting for new business and cross selling within current accounts
Ability to create and maintain relationships with Upper Management and C-level Buyers 
Ability to maintain excellent internal relationships, understanding who to go to for required resources
A proactive attitude and ability to communicate with a variety of individuals and skill levels in an appropriate manner
A motivated, competitive and results driven mindset
Ability to work independently and as part of a team, with a ‘can do’ attitude
Ability to multi-task and prioritize requirements, while maintaining a focus on quality work
Flexibility and a willingness to support outside of your direct area of responsibility

Understanding of time management, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment while embracing potential challenges 

What we offer
We are a people-focused, high-performing, high-trust managed security services team. We truly pride ourselves on our investment in people meaning you’ll always have opportunities to develop yourself and get involved in developing others. Our range of benefits we offer include:

Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance
Generous vacation time and paid holidays
401(k) Plan and Company Matching Contributions
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)

Flexible Spending Account (FSA) and Commuter Benefits Program Available 

Apply?
Are you interested in this job? Apply now via the ‘apply’ button and upload your resume and cover letter.

 Consulting, Project Manager, Information Security, Technology, Research

IT Project Manager, Sourcing SolutionsThe IT Project Manager Sourcing Solutions will focus on identifying projects requirements, flagging gaps, documenting key requirements, developing, and managing multiple concurrent implementation projects.

Ability to create quality deliverables utilizing Microsoft Project, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio

We are committed to affirmatively providing equal opportunity to all associates and qualified applicants without regard to race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, marital status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, legally protected physical or mental disability or any other basis protected under applicable law.

HUGO BOSS is one of the leading premium fashion and lifestyle companies with around 14,600 employees worldwide. As the most important interface for our customers, you will demonstrate your passion for our products and act as a brand ambassador for HUGO BOSS. Join a team that provides an exceptional brand and shopping experience with enthusiasm, fun and expertise – because, to create something extraordinary, we must explore new paths together. Shape your own future at HUGO BOSS!
Jr Account Executive
HUGO BOSS Fashions, Inc. | New York City | United States | Full-time
  

The Jr. Account Executive will be responsible for supporting the sales team, having daily contact with customers and managing the day to day division responsibilities. S/he will be involved with the support of both major and specialty store accounts, as well as an emphasis on tracking basics business for all accounts. 
What you can expect: 
Responsibilities include, but not limited to the following:

Daily support on all aspects of Major Accounts
Showroom support for market appointments
Partner with AE’s in Market to ensure strong merchandise assortment and provide all collection updates
Responsible for monitoring monthly shipping plan and projections for major accounts
Ship account base on-order to meet monthly shipping goals
Responsible for select Specialty Stores
Support Sales Manager responsible for managing basics business for division
Partner with AE’s on all aspects of retail sales monthly and managing customer plans
Advise account base of merchandise ready and any production issues
Monitor account base selling, track weekly selling, door selling, seasonal turn, and seasonal margin.
Analyze business trends and product opportunities for overall business
Create Seasonal on order books for accounts to be distributed to all doors
Set up the showroom for market
Enter pre-orders into SAP system for current selling season
Ensure all orders are booked complete; managing all sell outs and substitutions
Fix all EDI related issues for assigned account base
Release all orders for delivery
Order management in SAP (update cancellations, changes, “cleaning” orders at end of each season
Generate BIS reports
Track all incoming product shipments (by style) from Germany with support of the Merchandising Team
Assist in scheduling market appointments for all new business
Conduct Product Knowledge meetings for Select Major doors and Specialty Stores (domestic travel)
Weekly visits to NY stores, and Monthly store visits to tri-state area locations to merchandise store floor and fill in product. 
Order and support in managing all online and advertising samples for the team, as well as track all samples sent out to accounts 
Update monthly inventory report for Team, on style and size level with sketches
Responsible for all digital guidelines
Support on all internal department planning reports, with an emphasis on basic sales/ shipments
Support all Women’s Events and Conclaves   
Communicate and collaborate with warehouse on all shipping issues for the Women’s Team
Responsible for creating and maintaining all department logs- Shipping, Cancellations, Discounts, etc.
Support in training of  new hires in department on SAP and BIS- when applicable


Your profile:

Bachelor's Degree (preferably in Business or Fashion Merchandising)
2+ years of proven wholesale experience 
Keen understanding of the department store business and how to analyze the business with “retail math” (ie., VMT reports, sell through, on-hands, inventory, and margin)
Excellent speaking / presentation skills 
Excellent computer skills with an emphasis on Microsoft Excel
SAP  recommended



Your benefits:
HUGO BOSS offers a comprehensive benefits package which includes:

Hybrid Working Model
Flexible Commuting
Flexible Fridays & Summer Fridays
21 paid days off (pro-rated based on first year of employment) plus your Birthday off
Generous Employee Discount Program
Medical, Dental, Vision Benefits with Health Saving Account (HSA) option
401(K) with company match
Flex Spending Account (FSA)
Commuter Benefits (Pre-tax)
Voluntary Benefits and Critical Illness
Company sponsored Life and Disability benefits
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
Discounts for auto/home/pet insurance 
Gym membership discount
  


Fashion is a form of self-expression. With our products, we want to inspire individuality and encourage everyone to be their authentic selves. HUGO BOSS is a global company with our employees representative of the world at large. We believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce, and are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of, but not limited to, age, citizenship, disability, gender identity or expression, national origin, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, marital status, or sexual orientation.

Follow and accurately manage existing installation projects to ensure that projects close-out at the required efficiency and profitability levels
Review and book projects within one (1) week of award, notifying the Manager if required completion dates cannot be met, and providing action plan and time frame for completion
Provide approved submittals to Schindler Engineering and/or local vendors following project booking; coordinate and follow up with factory, local vendors and superintendent on the delivery of project material to ensure that all required material is ready prior to project start date
Interface with the Field Superintendent to track job progress and notify manager if required completion dates cannot be met; provide action plan and time frame for completion

Job Description
At the PlowShare Group, the role of media will be to go beyond the standard practice of measuring and achieving campaign and client goals. Our mission in media will be to deliver those results and use them as a force in rebuilding trust between our core institutions, whether in government or public service, and the people that they serve. We will do that by developing and fostering a functional and transparent media organization dedicated to that same mission of service that will deliver the right messages to those in the most need them within environments and entities that in those values and will work toward rebuilding that trust with us.
PlowShare is currently seeking a motivated SOCIAL MEDIA MANAGER with 3-5 years of agency experience to join our growing team. The Social Media Manager will be responsible for planning, creating, and implementing social media and content marketing efforts for social cause and behavior change campaigns. A successful candidate will also be required to collect, review, and evaluate social and digital platform data to develop more effective programs. Additionally, you will need to assist agency staff in the day-to-day activities across a variety of marketing disciplines where this content may be placed or published.
Our ideal candidate is an experienced professional with strong problem solving skill, detail oriented and works well under deadlines.. Ultimately, this person will oversee all marketing content initiatives for clients to ensure user engagement, brand consistency and a positive experience.
CORE RESPONSIBILITIES:
* Collaborate with marketing and creative design teams to develop and update style and layout guidelines for a brands content based on platform best practices
* Administrate the creation, client review process and publishing of relevant, original, high-quality content
* Edit, proofread content, presentations and reports for consistency and quality control of client deliverables
* Work with partners and sub-contractors to develop a content calendar based on a set of approved concepts and themes
* Ensure content is in compliance with law (e.g., copyright and data protection), platform policies, platform specifications, and brand guidelines
* Provide client service support to ensure that all assignments are completed timely and accurately
* Stay up to date with digital and social platform developments and generate new ideas to draw audiences attention
* Execute, monitor, and optimize organic and paid social media campaigns across platforms to achieve program objectives
* Assist web team with any pixel placement, UTM development and data collection to help evaluate ROI attributed to paid media activities
* Use web and social media analytics tools such as Google Analytics and Facebook Ads Reporting to analyze website traffic and evaluate user social engagement metrics
* Identify and improve on organizational processes to increase efficiency and improve client content and client communication
* Create social media reports to be shared with stakeholders throughout the organization at a determined cadence that can accurately show performance and ROI of the social campaigns
* Assist agency staff on management of projects and programs for earned media, social media and partnerships teams

Job Description
Report to the Global Process Lead and is responsible for leading the process workstream for the SAP SuccessFactors Onboarding 2.0 implementation in multiple countries simultaneously with varying degrees of complexity.
RESPONSIBILITIES
* Lead and monitor country recruiting & talent teams through the Onboarding implementation process as the process lead
* Review and consult on current business processes to determine fit with global process.
* Provide recommendations for improvements to internal processes to provide efficiency and effectiveness.
* Lead regular meetings with country leads and be the liaison between the PMO, country teams and vice-versa
* Serve as a liaison and first line of contact for the HRIS Implementation team.
* Report and escalate issues to Global Process Lead as needed
* Maintain process workstream workplan, documentation and deliverables
* Work with the Global Process Lead to manage changes to the project schedule and/or scope.
* Assist with product testing when necessary.
* Report and maintain enhancement requests considered out of scope for initial implementation.

Job Description
At Publicis Groupe, cloud computing continues to allow us to modernize and consolidate IT infrastructure, automate workloads, and pursue next-generation innovation. To continue this transformation, were seeking an experienced DevOps Engineer with expertise in Infrastructure as Code, CI\CD tools and process, implementation and support of projects in the cloud. The ideal candidate is experienced in cloud-based tech, mostly AWS and GCP, with a firm DevOps background.
RESPONSIBILITIES OF THIS ROLE
* Design, implement and support cloud infrastructure
* Design, implement and support Kubernetes workloads
* Develop standard IaC templates
* Select and deploy appropriate CI/CD tools
* Encouraging and building automated processes wherever possible
* Defining and setting development, test, release, update, and support processes for DevOps operation
* Incident management and root cause analysis
* Mentoring and guiding the team members

Job Description
The HR Generalist is a human resources partner for the various functional groups within Publicis Re:Sources, including IT, Legal, Financial Operations, Real Estate, Global Security and others.The Generalist is accountable for implementing HR processes with their functions and counselling managers on people-related decisions (with guidance). The Generalist handles all facets of HR as assigned, including Employee Relations, Talent Acquisition, Performance Management and Change Management. The HR Generalist also participates in Publicis Re:Sources HR function-wide projects or initiatives and champions and contributes to Publicis Re:Sources culture.
The individual must be able to handle multiple priorities and communicate objectively and confidently. The HR Generalist will have exposure to sensitive and confidential information necessitating diplomacy, discretion, and sound judgment.
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
* Business Partnership Partner with client groups management to ensure HR practices that support business goals and objectives.
* Performance Management Manage performance review processes for functional group(s). Ensure timely communication.
* Talent Acquisition - Assist with sourcing, assessing and closing candidates to meet hiring managers needs.
* Onboarding manage new hires and offboarding any leavers
* HR Information Systems Ensure employee data integrity for client group. Effectively utilize tools and technology.
* Compliance & Operational Excellence Ensure compliance with local employment laws and regulations. Ensure effective employee relations.
* Leave Management - Manage leaves of absence for assigned groups

Job Description
As a Senior Art Director on Family Care, youre working on globally recognized, category leading brands. These brands are significant contributors to the success of our client and as Publicis Groupes largest client. Your work will be seen by tens of millions of consumers and will be held to the highest standards. Youre an important member of a high-performance team and were counting on your best effort on every assignment, every day.
Your success in this role is something you and the Agency are mutually invested in. Its important to your career. Its important to the performance of the agency. As such, we want you to have a clear understanding of whats required to be successful.
* Senior Art Director must have strong conceptual skills and a highly developed ability to bring those concepts to life through ideas that can be executed across a wide variety of continuously evolving communications channels. The work must always be executed to the highest of standards and craft.
* Senior Art Director must have excellent design skills and attention to detail for both presentations and full-up production.
* Senior Art Director should have the ability to comprehend sophisticated strategic briefs and develop work thats on strategy and is consistent with the brand character.
* Senior Art Director should have the ability to develop a variety of ideas and approaches for each assignment and should not be limited to providing only a single option.
* Senior Art Director must have and portfolio must show experience across a wide array of channels including TV, online video, online banners, social platforms, and print. The job requires that the Senior AD stays current with evolving channel formats and takes initiative to be well-versed in those formats and able to execute within them. 
* Senior Art Director should possess strong communications skills and be able to present work intelligently and concisely in internal reviews and in client meetings. 
*This is a fast-paced industry that requires agility, resourcefulness, resilience and personal initiative. This is not a job for passive participants. Our clients expect us to be pro-active in bringing them ideas that will help solve challenges and grow their business. All members of the team are expected to embody this ethic.

Job Description
Re:Sources is looking for a401(k) Compliance Specialist to join our Benefits team.The ideal candidate will be responsible for benefits administration, customer service, vendor bill pay, compliance, retirement plan reconciliation and funding.
Responsibilities
* Provide benefits administration support
* Analyze billing invoices to identify and resolve discrepancies and irregularities that may arise
* Develop efficient procedures while providing strategic recommendations for administration
* Prepare analysis of vendor accounts as needed
* Weekly, Biweekly, Semi-monthly reconciliation of 401k and prepare for funding
* Generate monthly/quarterly 401k employee cost allocations for distribution to Agencies
* Assist third party vendors with collection of data for Form 5500 preparation
* Ensure all financial reporting deadlines are met, internally and externally
* Journal Entry data preparation and posting monthly using SAP
* Monthly auditing and reporting of financial transactions for Month-End Processes

Job Description
ABOUT THE ROLE:
The Art Supervisor will develop and execute concept and layout for print, broadcast, video, and interactive media with minimal supervision
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
* Work together with copywriters, art directors and account team to provide creative, strategically sound solutions for client, in-house and new business needs
* Own jobs, beginning to end
* Write and reference promotional material without supervision
* Constantly look for new, compelling presentation
* Supervise and direct art directors and junior art directors
* Clearly communicate information and direction to other art directors as well as suppliers, freelancers, and editorial staff
* Participate in client meetings and presentations
* Attend market research
* Work closely with the copy, editorial and project management departments to ensure that projects are completed according to deadlines
* Present work in an organized and interesting manner

Job Description
* Draft, review and negotiate a wide variety of contracts, including client-agency, supplier/media owner, sponsorship, talent, influencer, confidentiality, and intellectual property licenses and agreements
* Provide legal advice on an ongoing basis in areas of advertising and media law, including but not limited to claim substantiation, trademark clearance, copyright, rights of privacy and publicity, user-generated content, and media and social media matters
* Review marketing materials to ensure compliance with Federal and State laws, rules and regulations, as well as adherence to best industry practices
* Conduct preliminary trademark searches and review full trademark searches
* Educate, advise, and counsel management on legal issues affecting business decisions
* Provide periodic training to business units on key legal issues affecting operations
* Provide day-to-day legal support to the business teams
* Standardize templates, processes and legal guidance where possible to improve efficiency of legal services to business units

Job Description
The Treasury Virtual Card and Cashflow/Forecast Analyst will report to the VP Asst Treasurer of Banking and Systems and will be responsible for various analysis associated with the VC program and which will feed the monitoring and management of the VC project and ongoing use of the tool. This candidate should have 3-5 years of treasury experience (preferably some experience with credit card payment execution). This role will also be responsible to backfill certain duties of the Asst Treasurer while some of his focus also shifts to implementation and maximization of the VC project.
THE KEY DELIVERABLES/RESPONSIBILITIES FOR THIS POSITION INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO THE FOLLOWING:
* Assistance in implementation of VC project, which will consist of:
o Understanding project scope
o Attending implementation calls and taking thorough notes and ensuring follow ups are detailed and executed
o Tracking success through supplier enrollments 
* Ability to understand TWC (Trade Working Capital) and Net Debt and be able to report and explain details as well as read and interpret trend data (backfill role)
* Ability to use various sources of data to aggregate into a consolidated view
* Daily reporting to senior management on various cashflow aspects including TWC and NDIC
* Extract reporting from dashboards into an executive summary
* Experience with Excel a must and SAP, Global Data Warehouse, and Power BI preferred
* Participate in special projects as needed

Role Purpose:

Underwrite profitable new and renewal business to meet LoB(s) targets in accordance with underwriting guidelines and underwriting authority
Negotiate price and terms and conditions 
Ownership of key accounts / clients 
Develop and maintain strong relationships with producers and clients in partnership with Market Management
Coach and mentor Underwriters

Key Responsibilities:
Support Underwriting Strategy:

Participate in the development and execution of regional Underwriting strategy for LoB(s) 
Work closely with Market Management, Claims and other product lines to achieve key marketing strategies, including cross- selling  

Underwrite Profitable business

Underwrite new and renewal accounts to meet top and bottom line targets
Negotiate price and terms and conditions with producers
Proactively manage capacity 
Underwrite and evaluate Natural Catastrophe Accumulation, ensuring an understanding of catastrophe modeling and interpretation of scenarios (for relevant LoBs)
Underwrite International Insurance Programs (for relevant LoBs)

Relationship Management

Positively represent AGCS externally to the market
Proactively drive involvement of functional areas in Underwriting process, including e.g. MMC, ARC, Claims, Operations
Develop and maintain strong relationships with key producers and clients and other relevant stakeholders (e.g. risk managers)

Policy Documentation and Administration

Ensure accurate policy documentation issued to producers (where AGCS responsibility to do so) or producers has issued documentation (where producer responsibility)
File maintenance – ensure file is established (whether electronic or paper) and maintained for each risk and transaction handled
Proactively support completion of policy administration and credit control processes

Market Management                                                                                                                                                                        

Proactively support acquisition of new business and retention of existing business  (including client and producer negotiations where necessary)
Proactively liaise with MMC on market management initiatives

Support Key Business Initiatives/Misc.:

Participate / contribute to key projects
Training and development of underwriters in Lob,  e.g.  Associate Underwriters and Underwriters
Referral point for other underwriters 
Participate in cross regional activities as required / requested        

Required Skills:

7-10 years’ experience and a proven track record in Underwriting profitable business in LoB with 11 plus years' experience
In depth understanding of LoB(s) products and portfolio
In depth understanding of regional / local LoB (s) insurance markets and competitor landscape
Demonstrable, established relationships with brokers at peer group level and well established within local market
Ability to assess risk inherent exposures and natural hazards relevant to LoB
Manage the underwriting books. Analyze trends and scenario plans from which portfolio strategies can be developed and implemented.
Analyze current performance against various benchmarks with a view to ensure adequate progress and satisfactory performance
Apply the knowledge of how the market operates and functions, the business needs and customer needs
Ability to analyze highly complex data, from multiple sources, in detail; identify and resolve issues before they transpire.
Ability to express ideas and messages clearly, both written and verbally.  Ability to "sell" an improvised or prepared audience winning story

Compensation is commensurate with skills and experience and includes a comprehensive best in class benefits package.  Any salary or benefits information provided by third party resources such as external job posting websites etc., cannot be deemed reliable.
Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us. Join us. Let’s care for tomorrow.
We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in.
Allianz Global Corporate & Specialty (AGCS) is a leading global corporate insurance carrier and a key business unit of Allianz Group. We provide risk consultancy, Property-Casualty insurance solutions and alternative risk transfer for a wide spectrum of commercial, corporate and specialty risks across 10 dedicated lines of business.
Our customers are as diverse as business can be, ranging from Fortune Global 500 companies to small businesses, and private individuals. Among them are not only the world’s largest consumer brands, tech companies and the global aviation and shipping industry, but also wineries, satellite operators or Hollywood film productions. They all look to AGCS for smart answers to their largest and most complex risks in a dynamic, multinational business environment and trust us to deliver an outstanding claims experience.
Worldwide, AGCS operates with its own teams in 32 countries and through the Allianz Group network and partners in over 200 countries and territories, employing over 4,300 people. As one of the largest Property-Casualty units of Allianz Group, we are backed by strong and stable financial ratings. In 2019, AGCS generated a total of €9.1 billion gross premium globally.
For more information, visit www.agcs.allianz.com or follow us on Twitter @AGCS_Insurance and LinkedIn.

Job description, responsibilities and dutiesFor our Control Hub looking for a Business Control Officer to coordinate global Key Control Testing (KCT) testing activities for our ING locations. In Bratislava We provide key control testing activities for ING Wholesale banking locations globally in order to make sure our ING branches worldwide are compliant from procedural and process perspective with the Global minimum standards (controls). Some of your daily tasks:• Create KCT planning for Control Hub in Bratislava• Coordinate key control testing activities between ING locations globally, testers in Bratislava and second line monitoring by ORM and Compliance• Further alignment with Control Hub in Manila.• Working on continuous improvements and further implementation of Agile way of working.• Support with operational activities like, for example, reporting on progress.
Your working environmentIBSS Bratislava (ING Bank Shared Services Bratislava) is the servicing hub for ING Wholesale entities for their 1st line of defense risk management activities. These are exciting times for us as we are migrating more work not only focused on operational tasks, but more and more knowledge work in design and consultancy roles such as key control testing. We are part of the IBSS organization which consists of servicing hubs around the globe. The vision is to centralize the processing activities of ING to these servicing hubs to help harmonize and standardize products and processes in order to give an outstanding and differentiating client experience to all clients of ING worldwide

Information about the selection processPlease, send us your CV via the apply button. Please note, that we will reply only to selected candidates. Thank you for your understanding.
Required educationUniversity education (Bachelor's degree)University education (Master's degree)Postgraduate (Doctorate)

Disney Streaming comprises the leading premium streaming services offering live and on-demand TV and movies, with and without commercials, both in and outside the home. Operating at the intersection of entertainment and technology, Disney Streaming has a unique opportunity to be the number one choice for TV and Movies. We captivate and connect viewers with the stories they love, and were looking for people who are passionate about redefining the industry through innovation, unconventional thinking, and embracing fun.
Join us and see what Disney Streaming life is all about. Do you want to join an award-winning team at the fastest growing company in streaming TV? Were seeking a Lead Product Designer for our Enterprise Product Design team who wants to build beautifully crafted, impactful, business-changing products.
This role will lead product design for the Business Intelligence (BI) vertical within our Enterprise Product Design team. You will oversee the work of at least one other designer and potentially be a people manager for them. You will be the primary point of contact for projects with the BI domain, and as such, you will contribute to the roadmap and set the product design strategy for the BI tools.
The right candidate will have extensive experience leading long-term, complex projects from inception to launch (and data-informed iteration). You'll need to be an effective cross-functional problem solver who demonstrates extreme ownership and is comfortable presenting to executive stakeholders. Having an ecosystem-centered mindset will help you succeed in this role, as the products we design affect multiple areas of Disney Streamings business.
A note about location: We are a distributed team with offices in NYC, SF, Burbank, Santa Monica and Seattle. Were still working remote, but looking toward a hybrid model when its safe to reopen offices. Wed like this role to be located commuting distance from one of our offices but will consider exceptional remote candidates.
Responsibilities : Lead product design for the Business Intelligence domain, overseeing the work of at least one other designer and potentially being a people manager for them. Be an excellent human, exhibiting compassion for your teammates and integrity in your actions and decisions
Apply your expert skills in application design, visual design, creative and analytical thinking, and productive workflows to design new products and improve existing onesPerform all functions of the product design lifecycle, including research, concepts, wireframes, prototypes, high fidelity mockups, documentation, and testingContribute to product strategy by defining problems in insightful ways, understanding business needs, and innovating within technical constraintsArticulate, negotiate, and refine design requirements in collaboration with product managers and engineersUtilize quantitative and qualitative data to inform design decisionsContribute to and help maintain component librariesBe the voice in the room that always puts the user first while balancing the needs of the businessBasic Qualifications : 7+ years experience designing & shipping software1+ years of experience leading other designers either as a project lead or people managerCraft and mastery in multiple design skills, design thinking, and design processStrong ability to prioritize work and resources across engagements based on short and long-term needsHigh aptitude for teamwork and open collaborationConsulting skills to help stakeholders & partners uncover project goals, constraints & dependencies; and then guide them to optimal solutionsPassion for evolving the design practice; its people, processes, and toolsExperience with various design tools and interfaces  Figma, Sketch, Abstract, Invision, prototyping toolsWorking knowledge of web technologies like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and responsive layouts

The DMED Technology organization plays a central role in the future growth of The Walt Disney Company. Our team is responsible for worldwide linear and digital media distribution, design and development of all consumer-facing digital products, advertising technology, consumer data, and international broadcast operations.
Our employees are leading, creating, and innovating, making bold moves in unexpected directions that redefine not just what a media company does, but what it can do. With The Walt Disney Company, you can be part of media's evolution, helping us create what's next.
The DMED team in Santa Monica is seeking a Sr. Software Development in Test Engineer to join our Engineering Services team to build test automation and processes to ensure the quality of our advertising systems. When our systems work properly, they are able to reliably deliver relevant ads to all of our viewers; driving higher revenue for our business and helping our customers to discover brands and products that are relevant to their interests.
Defects in our ad systems can negatively impact revenue and deliver advertisements that detract from the viewer experience due to irrelevance, repetition, and other factors. This is a unique opportunity to join an excellent team and have a meaningful impact on the QE and automation process and culture, as well as the products we release. As a result, those most likely to excel in this role are independent, creative, and able to operate effectively in ambiguous circumstances.
If you are interested in a testing role with a heavy emphasis on automated testing where the results of your testing will have a significant impact on the business and be highly visible to company leadership, then this might be the right opportunity for you! Remote Work is an option for this position
Responsibilities : Work closely with Software Engineers to understand the complex advertising ecosystem in place at DTCIDevelop automated test frameworks and suites on UI, API, and Integration levels of testing using python or other OO languageParticipate in design discussions for our platform to help evolve the platform in a way that enables richer testing scenarios that simplify defect detection and preventionAssist with triage, diagnosis, and resolution of issues discovered across teams.Contribute to end-to-end acceptance testsWhere necessary, develop and execute manual test cases to detect issues that cannot be detected through automated meanDrive the conversion of manual tests to automated whenever possibleBasic Qualifications : Minimum of 4 years of hands-on software test development experience, including both functional and non-functional test developmentPassion around driving best practices in the testing spaceProficiency with Python or other OO languageKnowledge of software engineering practices and agile approachesStrong desire for establishing and improving product qualityExperience building or improving test automation frameworks.Proficiency CICD integration and pipeline development in Jenkins, Spinnaker or other similar tools.Proficiency in UI automation ( Selenium, Robot, Watir)Experience in Gherkin ( BDD /TDD )Willingness to take challenges head-on while being part of a teamRequired Education : B.S. in Computer Science or equivalent degree or work experience

General Description
The Financial Aid Specialist coordinates the intake process for students who need financial aid counseling and provides expertise while assisting front counter staff in responding to students with questions related to financial aid to ensure students receive the highest level of customer service and support. This position collaborates with the Student Tuition Assistance Office, Office of Records and Registration, Office of Dean of Students, and various other offices to research and resolve financial aid payment problems, bookstore credits holds and other matters affecting student aid.  The Financial Aid Specialist counsels students and parents on financial aid; reviews verifies and awards financial aid packages; represents the College at on-campus and off-campus events, and assists in the supervision of the Office’s federal work-study students.  


Specific Responsibilities
• Counsel prospective students, continuing students, parents, and families regarding the financial aid application process and eligibility for Federal and State aid, and assist them with the online process of completing a FAFSA application.  • Assist students in applying for Federal and private loans and scholarships, understanding and completing the institutional payment plan, and resolve rejected aid applications.  • Communicate with students and families via written, voice, and electronic media in order to relay information about student’s eligibility or to request further documentation to determine eligibility.  • Track documentation received by students utilizing the document management process; create files for new students and continuing students; appropriately file, at Main Campus, documents received at Regional Centers and merge documents for students that possess duplicate files.  • Update student’s aid in Banner, add student loans to student’s aid package; correspond with Coordinator, Student Loan Program to ensure student is receiving appropriate amount requested.  • Verify information on the Institutional Student Information Report (ISIR) and compare with the information on the student’s or parent’s Federal tax return.  • Collaborate with outside offices, research and resolve financial aid payment problems, including those identified by Student Tuition Services office and Office of Student Records and Registration.  • Resolve Student Tuition Services Office holds and explain resolution to students.  • Work with advisors and counselors to make recommendations to students who were dropped for poor scholarship; correspond with Records and Registration to resolve enrollment status issues and to ensure that student has completed required testing.  • Conduct workshops and presentations for new and continuing students.  • Generate and reconcile reports.  • Represent the College at on-campus and off-campus events.  • Conduct online filing workshops, as required.  • Periodic assignment to Main Campus, as needed.  • Adhere to FERPA regulations as they pertain to maintaining the security and confidentiality of all student records, as well as maintain the confidentiality of other documents on behalf of the work area and the College.  • Perform assigned duties in a manner consistent with the mission, goals, and core values of the College.  • Maintain sensitivity, understanding, and respect for a diverse academic environment, inclusive of students, faculty, and staff of varying social, economic, cultural, ideological, and ethnic backgrounds.  • Deliver quality customer services to both internal and external constituents in a professional helpful and courteous manner.  • Other duties as assigned.


Minimum Qualifications
• Bachelor’s degree required. Any and all degrees must be from a recognized institutional accreditor.  • A minimum of one (1) year of full-time work experience in financial aid required.  • Excellent communication (oral and written) and interpersonal skills in all media (phone, face to face, and email).  • Demonstrated knowledge of financial aid regulations required.  • Experience working with people from culturally diverse and economic backgrounds.  • Ability to use independent judgment in making administrative/procedural decisions with minimal supervision.  • Strong customer services and collaboration skills required.  • Must be able to foster a positive and productive work environment, with ability to help lead and motivate staff, and model exceptional service to internal and external customers.  • Ability to demonstrate a positive attitude towards daily challenges and ability to process high volumes of work with accuracy required.  • Ability to manage multiple, simultaneous priorities and meet deadlines required.  • Demonstrated proficiency using MS Word and Excel, and Internet applications.  • Access to reliable transportation is required.


Special Instructions to Applicants

All College employees must be fully vaccinated, or have an approved exemption from the College and submit to regular COVID testing as an accommodation.Positions located at the College’s Main campus and regional centers within the Philadelphia area.Interested persons should complete an online application.  Cover letter of interest and resume REQUIRED.  *Names and contact information of 3 professional references OPTIONAL.  Review of applications will continue until the position is filled.  Applicants must be legally eligible to work in the U.S.  Community College of Philadelphia is an Affirmative Action, Equal Opportunity and Equal Access Employer. The College encourages applications from individuals from traditionally underrepresented groups.
column10: COMMUNITY COLLEGE OF PHILADELPHIA–Financial District, NY

Position Type : Full time Type Of Hire : Experienced (relevant combo of work and education) Travel Percentage : 0%At FIS you’ll have the opportunity to work on some of the most challenging and relevant issues in financial services and technology. FIS stays ahead of how the world is evolving to power businesses, across merchants, banking and capital markets, to outpace today’s fast-changing competitive landscape and help our clients run, grow and achieve more for their business.
About the team
Our Financial Crimes Compliance team is responsible for managing and mitigating the financial crime risks that may occur through the payments we process for our global customers or the products and services our business provides.
What you will be doing
As a Senior Financial Crime Compliance Analyst, you will work as part of our Operations & Intelligence team investigating cases to identify possible money laundering, terrorist financing and wider financial crime risks, taking appropriate mitigating actions where required and SAR submissions..  You will also have engagement with internal and external  stakeholders including regulatory compliance, legal, our onboarding teams and the wider business, along with Law Enforcement agencies.  
What you bring:

3 to 5 year’s experience of AML/financial crime investigations
Knowledge of financial crime risks
Stakeholder engagement experience
High standard of written and verbal communication
Attention to detail
The ability to handle and resolve challenging situations
An open, honest and collaborative style.
A team player

Added bonus if you have:
An AML related qualification i.e (ICA) Diploma in AML, ICA qualifications around financial crime or (ACAMS) is desirable. 
Financial crime risk management in a global payment’s environment/large financial institution
What we offer you:

A multifaceted job with a high degree of responsibility and a broad spectrum of opportunities
The chance to work on some of the most challenging, relevant issues in financial crime
A work environment built on collaboration, flexibility and respect
Varied and challenging work to help you grow your technical skillset

Since our two companies came together, Worldpay has formed the Merchant Solutions division of FIS. FIS stays ahead of how the world is evolving to power businesses, across merchants, banking and capital markets, to outpace today’s fast-changing competitive landscape and help our clients run, grow and achieve more for their business.
Privacy Statement
FIS is committed to protecting the privacy and security of all personal information that we process in order to provide services to our clients. For specific information on how FIS protects personal information online, please see the Online Privacy Notice.
Sourcing Model
Recruitment at FIS works primarily on a direct sourcing model; a relatively small portion of our hiring is through recruitment agencies. FIS does not accept resumes from recruitment agencies which are not on the preferred supplier list and is not responsible for any related fees for resumes submitted to job postings, our employees, or any other part of our company.

As a Senior Financial Crime Compliance Analyst, you will work as part of our Operations & Intelligence team investigating cases to identify possible money laundering, terrorist financing and wider financial crime risks, taking appropriate mitigating actions where required and SAR submissions..  You will also have engagement with internal and external stakeholders including regulatory compliance, legal, our onboarding teams and the wider business, along with Law Enforcement agencies
What you will be doing
As a Financial Crime Operations Manager, you will be part of the Financial Crime Operations and Intelligence  team. You will manage a team within the L1 & L2 process , investigating cases to identify possible money laundering, terrorist financing and wider financial crime risks, taking appropriate mitigating actions where required and SAR submissions..  You will also have engagement with internal and external  stakeholders including regulatory compliance, legal, our onboarding teams and the wider business, along with Law Enforcement agencies
What you bring:

5 - 8 years’ experience of managing a team within AML/financial crime investigations, with large financial institution or fintech.
Knowledge of financial crime risks
Understanding or willingness to understand emerging financial crime trends and potential financial crime risks .
Knowledge of wider financial crime risks e.g. bribery and corruption, sanctions and money laundering. Terrorist Financing.
Internal and external Stakeholder engagement experience.
High standard of written and verbal communication.
Attention to detail.
The ability to handle and resolve challenging situations, work in a collaborative manner and be part of a wider Financial Crime Compliance team.

Added bonus if you have:
An anti-money laundering related qualification e.g. International Compliance Association (“ICA”) or Association of Certified Anti-Money Laundering Specialists (“ACAMS”).  
What we offer you

A multifaceted job with a high degree of responsibility and a broad spectrum of opportunities.
The chance to work on some of the most challenging, relevant issues in financial crime.
A work environment built on collaboration, flexibility and respect.
Varied and challenging work to help you grow your technical skillset.
This role could be based out of our London, Birmingham or Manchester offices.

Privacy Statement
FIS is committed to protecting the privacy and security of all personal information that we process in order to provide services to our clients. For specific information on how FIS protects personal information online, please see the Online Privacy Notice.
Sourcing Model
Recruitment at FIS works primarily on a direct sourcing model; a relatively small portion of our hiring is through recruitment agencies. FIS does not accept resumes from recruitment agencies which are not on the preferred supplier list and is not responsible for any related fees for resumes submitted to job postings, our employees, or any other part of our company.
#pridepass
column9: Financial Crime Operation and Intelligence Manager

column5:
The Assistant Project Leader will assist the Project Manager and Management Team in running existing installation projects, and together with the Project Manager will be responsible for all estimating and operations for those projects. The candidate will additionally work with sales reps, superintendents and customers to ensure specification are completely met; with Schindler superintendents and engineering to drive efficiency and resolve technical problems; and, with local and region management to ensure high quality and financially successful existing installations. This role is customer focused, and so the selected candidate must be able to connect with people and form outstanding customer relationships so as to advance Schindler's presence in the marketplace and ensure achievement of the organization's financial goals. Assistant Project Leaders are typically promoted to Project Manager, Field Supervisor, or Sale Rep roles after 2-3 years of demonstrated success.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
•    Follow and accurately manage existing installation projects to ensure that projects close-out at the required efficiency and profitability levels
•    Review and book projects within one (1) week of award, notifying the Manager if required completion dates cannot be met, and providing action plan and time frame for completion
•    Provide approved submittals to Schindler Engineering and/or local vendors following project booking; coordinate and follow up with factory, local vendors and superintendent on the delivery of project material to ensure that all required material is ready prior to project start date
•    Interface with the Field Superintendent to track job progress and notify manager if required completion dates cannot be met; provide action plan and time frame for completion
•    Seek change notice opportunities; prepare all change order paperwork and forward to the customer in a timely manner; follow up on change orders, received signed change orders from the customer prior to any related work being completed
•    Ensure timely invoicing and ensure projects are invoiced and paid to 90% before elevator turn over
•    Participate in Company professional development programs to enhance working knowledge of Elevator Company products, services and procedure

Schindler Elevator Corporation currently has an opportunity for an experienced Project Manager.
The most important criteria for this role is a proven successful track record of sales. This individual must be motivated to both achieve outstanding results and succeed in a competitive environment. 
The successful candidate will be a person of character who embodies Schindler's ideals of honesty and integrity, who maintains an optimistic attitude, is assured of success, and is not afraid to take calculated risks to enhance revenue growth. This role is customer focused, and the selected candidate must be able to connect with people to form outstanding customer relationships in order to advance Schindler Elevator's presence in the marketplace thus ensuring achievement of the organization's financial goals.
•    Follow and accurately manage existing installation projects to ensure that projects close-out at the required efficiency and profitability levels
•    Review and book projects within one (1) week of award, notifying the Manager if required completion dates cannot be met, and providing action plan and time frame for completion
•    Provide approved submittals to Schindler Engineering and/or local vendors following project booking; coordinate and follow up with factory, local vendors and superintendent on the delivery of project material to ensure that all required material is ready prior to project start date
•    Interface with the Field Superintendent to track job progress and notify manager if required completion dates cannot be met; provide action plan and time frame for completion
•    Seek change notice opportunities; prepare all change order paperwork and forward to the customer in a timely manner; follow up on change orders, received signed change orders from the customer prior to any related work being completed
•    Ensure timely invoicing and ensure projects are invoiced and paid to 90% before elevator turn over
•    Participate in Company professional development programs to enhance working knowledge of Elevator Company products, services and procedures

To apply: Please send your resume to *******@thisismkg.com.MKG is searching for a smart and enthusiastic Account Coordinator to help manage one of the agency’s keyaccounts out of our NYC office. The ideal candidate will have a genuine desire to roll up their sleeves, learn in a fast-paced environment, with the ability to problem-solve through ambiguity. The Account Coordinator will report directly to the Account Manager and will provide support to the full Account team. The Account Coordinator will support the Department to produce activations of small and medium-size. They will also play a key administrative role within the team. All programs will be in support of the client’s B2B Marketing efforts targeting their agency and brand side marketing clients across various industry tentpoles, brand-owned summits, and everything in between. Programs will be virtual through 2021 and will be both physical and integrated in the future.
Note: this client focuses on social networks, technology, and media.
Account Coordinator Responsibilities:


Support team in planning and executing all B2B programs, both virtual and physical.
They will transcribe and distribute meeting minutes, create and maintain event program status. reports/documents, production schedules, and task lists for all active projects.
Provide administrative support including organizing and maintaining internal and external resources.
Prepare meeting materials and author and circulate thorough notes for all status meetings and project-related meetings.
Actively contribute to creative ideation for brand activations and initiatives.
Track expenses; process, manage, and file invoices; Ensure all internal team members’ project expenses are requested and accounted for.
Shadow Account Executives/Managers on the business to learn the ins and outs of producing.
pre-recorded and live experiences.
Support coordinating all 3rd party vendors, generally to include virtual platforms, venue, catering, décor and furnishings, graphics, fabrication, installation and dismantle, labor, audiovisual, content capture, etc.
Provide assistance in event measurement, surveying, and reporting.
Work with 3rd party invitation software; write, design, and distribute invites for events.
Design and deploy communications via registration tool (as required): save-the-date, invites, reminders. to register, event reminders, thank you emails, post-event surveys.
Craft and send out post-satisfaction surveys to speakers and audiences to collect valuable insights for future planning and event analytics.
Track key feedback in the master database.
Manage calendars for internal and external meeting bookings.
Support management of large-scale cross-functional virtual programs by developing detailed project plans with activity-based milestones. Be prepared to do the same for in-person programs in the future.
Serve as internal brand custodian, organizing and maintaining internal resources, effectively communicating brand guidelines, goals, and expectations to resources within and outside the agency.
Support management and production of remote video shoots. This includes pre/post-production, and oversight of all video edits including but not limited to music, animations, interstitials, copy editing, etc.
When in-person, traveling 25-30%.

Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree.
1+ years of work experience involving project management, event production (physical & virtual), and client management.
Candidates must have 1-2 years of experience working directly with clients and internal teams to deliver on projects from client brief through to execution.
Experience across virtual event channels such as Zoom, Zoom Webinar, BlueJeans Events, and WebEx.
Have an understanding of the experiential landscape.
Have an interest in keeping up with the latest industry trends.
Be able to think creatively about a variety of challenges and apply their organizational skills accordingly.
Have excellent prioritization skills.
Ability to remain calm under pressure and when projects shifts occur.
Comfort presenting business and technical content to peers and general audiences.
Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate with clients and colleagues
Proficient in using Microsoft Office Programs, Google Suite, Adobe Photoshop, Keynote, Outlook, Marketing Tools.
Have the ability to manage up.
Ability to multi-task across multiple projects/disciplines.

Preferred Qualifications:

2+ years relevant experience client-facing experience within a creative agency, large production studio
and/or client-side in a tech company.
Remote and in-person production experience.
Copy-editing/writing skills
Based in New York City.
Open to COVID-safe travel.

National Inside Sales Manager Sales Account Manager (Base + uncapped Commission). Do you have a passion for exceeding expectations? Are you charismatic, bold and resourceful? Do you want the opportunity for unlimited income potential?If you see yourself as exceptional communicator, coupled with a competitive drive for success then you may be a fit for NOR Metals.
Located in the Financial District of NYC, Nor Metals is an exciting company rapidly expanding in the US. We are growing exponentially and we’re seeking motivated individuals who can contribute to the next phase of our company’s development. We know that a company’s success starts with its employees. The selected applicant will be an integral asset to our inside sales team, developing and managing territory assigned to the team. Join our dedicated team that services 25 countries world wide! *
ABOUT NOR METALS: 
For over 40 years, NOR Metals strives to always give their clients the best possible return for their precious metal waste. NOR Metals has gained substantial experience in the field of precious metal recycling, allowing us to count ourselves among the most advanced and trustworthy in the industry in Europe and spreading our presence here in the US.
DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

This role will require you to push, control the conversation and use your personality over the phone to be charismatic and likeable.
Ability to demonstrate positive and energetic phone skills and excellent listening skills.
Enjoy working in a fast-paced environment while maintaining a professional attitude.
Competitive spirit with a strong desire to succeed, exceed goals, and maximize opportunities.
Proven ability to network and build rapport.
Ability to use initiative and can adapt under pressure.
Possess strong negotiation, and closing skills.
Goal oriented and highly motivated person.
Time and work process management skills with the ability to work independently.
Strong communication, negotiation and interpersonal skills who is able to speak and read English clearly, though bilingual or multilingual is a plus.
Drives performance targets to completion.
Inside sales experience is a plus but not required.

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING?:

Contributing to booking tours as a part of an amazing team of 25 people.
Scheduling appointments for outside field representatives.
Calling potential clients and following up.
Pitching, persuading and being a vital member to tour scheduling.
Maintain accurate records in CRM.
Identify leads, manage prospects and acquire new business.
Consistently meet or exceed weekly and monthly sales activity goals.
Follow up on all assigned leads to drive sales opportunities in a timely manner.

Working Hours:

Monday - Thursday: 8am-5pm.
Friday: 8am - 12pm.
Weekends/Major Holidays: Off.

BENEFITS/COMPENSATION:

Hourly rate, plus uncapped commission, and bonuses.
Dedicated training and support throughout employment.
Uncapped Commissions + Bonus.
Top performers have the chance to win monthly prizes including TV’s, massages, gaming consoles, trips, dinners and more.
Unique start up culture where You really matter.
Benefits Plan.
Paid holidays/vacation/sick days.
Sales contests and games, team building activities.
Career Advancement opportunities.

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.
Visa Sponsorship - Not available. 'COVID-19 Precaution(s):

Remote interview process.
Personal protective equipment provided or required.
Plastic shield at work stations.
Temperature screenings.
Social distancing guidelines in place.
Sanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place.

Work Location:
One location.
Work Remotely: No.

Job Type: Full-time.
Pay: $17.00 per hour.

Job Summary
As a Sales Associate, you are our most important brand ambassador, bringing your own personal style, passion for the product and energy to the sales floor each day. You’ll help us welcome everyone into the Madewell community, create genuine connections, become an expert on all things denim, and help customers express their authentic selves (and sometimes you’ll simply help them check an item off their list).  You’ll collaborate with team members and managers to drive the business, jump in on tasks that help create a seamless experience, and bring a collaborative, kind, and inclusive energy to the sales floor.
Job Responsibilities

Drive sales by exceeding selling and service expectations.
Complete training, use product knowledge tools, participate in fit sessions and put those experiences to use.
Assist in store tasks—our customers should always see us at our best.
Share feedback, insights and ideas with the management team.
Act in a manner that aligns with our values.

(About you) You’ll be great in the role if you …

Make the best first impression—smile, welcome and connect with customers authentically.
Love the brand and have a great fashion aesthetic.  
Do what it takes to create seamless, amazing experiences customers can’t stop talking about.
Bring your best to everything you do and achieve your goals.
Are flexible, and ready to have fun along the way.
Leverage technology , while also knowing that devices don’t dominate the dialogue.
Build productive relationships with everyone on the team and always respect each other.
Are at least 18 years old.
Are available when we are busy, including: nights, weekends and holidays.
Can bend, reach, stretch as well as lift, carry and move at least 40 pounds | 18 kilos.
Can regularly move around all store areas and be accessible to customers.

Before we wrap, a word about a few of our way cool perks…

Competitive base pay and bonus programs
Flexible days and hours
Amazing merchandise discounts
24/7 free confidential help with a variety of personal and work concerns
Personal and professional development
Giving back –volunteer program, disaster relief funds, charitable matching donations*
Medical, dental, vision, life insurance, pet insurance, legal plan, ID theft, commuter benefit*
Time Away – paid time off, holidays, parental leave, disability leave, bereavement* 
401(k) plan with company matching contributions*

*Note: availability of these benefits and perks may be subject to work location & employment type and may have certain eligibility requirements.
We are committed to affirmatively providing equal opportunity to all associates and qualified applicants without regard to race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, legally protected physical or mental disability or any other basis protected under applicable law.

Area of Manhattan. This Position is:Part TimeWorkdays Available: Monday and SaturdayMorning Shift (8am-4pm) Ideal Candidate must Obtain a F85 and/or F89 Certificate of Fitness The primary mission of the Fire Life Safety Director is to protect life and property through the implementation of the building's fire safety plan including the management of the Fire Command Station and the supervision of the fire brigade, floor wardens, and deputy floor wardens and building evacuation supervisors.
The successful Fire Safety Director candidate is required to act as a liaison to the NYC Fire Department during emergencies. Expected skills and competencies necessary to perform duties include, but are not limited to:Ensure that all life safety systems and related equipment are fully functional. Ensure that all floors have fire safety teams including Fire Wardens, Deputy Fire Wardens, and Building Evacuation Team members.
Conduct fire alarm drills and maintain a written log of critiques to identify potential or actual weaknesses in response time or life safety systems and related equipment. Providing clear direction, information and assistance to client visitors, guests, vendors and employees in a professional, pleasant and courteous fashion on a regular basis and during emergency situations. Assist the building security staff in the visual inspection of all visitor, vendor and employee access badges/identification cards to verify that the authorized holder is the individual presenting the badge/id card to prevent unauthorized access to the property.
Maintain surveillance and reporting of any suspicious persons and/or packages. Perform CPR/AED and basic first aid if required. column5:
We are an established real estate law firm with offices across California. Our Los Angeles office is looking for a full-time Discovery Clerk to join our fast-paced team. If chosen as the successful candidate, you will assist attorneys and other individuals involved with the discovery phase of litigation.
About Us:
With over 40 years in the California legal industry and five offices statewide, our firm was founded on a commitment to customer service that has flourished within our culture of inclusion and diversity. We believe in working hard for our clients each day and in taking care of our employees so they are empowered to do their very best work. It is our mission to provide the highest quality, cost-effective legal services to our clients.
Responsibilities:

Propounding and responding to discovery, and implementing attorney feedback.
Drafting meets and confers letters, calendaring deadlines, noticing depositions, objecting to deposition notices.
File management and tracking discovery responses.
Assist with case intake by reviewing leases, legal forms, and correspondence for specific information and analyzing facts.
Contact clients as needed to obtain missing case-related information.
Perform additional administrative duties as needed by the department.

Qualifications:
We are looking for candidates with the following qualifications:

Experience with propounding and responding to written discovery requests.
Experience with drafting and responding to discovery meet and confer letters regarding discovery.
Experience with California litigation process and courts.
Strong written communication skills with high attention to detail.
Comfortable speaking with business professionals.
Self-starter who can succeed in a fast-paced, high-volume environment with minimal oversight.
Strong organizational skills; ability to multi-task and follow up with clients.
Minimum typing speed of 45 wpm.

The following qualifications are preferred: 

Experience with preparing subpoenas, jury documents, and trial binders.
Knowledge of unlawful detainers.
ProLaw experience.
2+ years of legal support experience.
Paralegal certificate from an ABA-approved program or equivalent training/experience. 

Schedule:
Position is full-time at 40 hours/week. Our business hours are 8:30am-5:30pm Monday-Thursday, 8:30am-5:00pm Friday.
This position will be performed from the office. We are not considering remote candidates at this time.
Why Work for Us?
Our firm offers a rewarding work environment that values a work-life balance and fosters a culture of professional growth and opportunities. We provide a comprehensive compensation package that includes 401(k), paid vacation, and sick time.
What employees are saying about working with us:

“The people, atmosphere, culture, and work/life balance are great.”

We are an established real estate law firm with offices across California. Our Los Angeles office is looking for a Trial Attorney to join our fast-paced team. If chosen as the successful candidate, you will be responsible for litigating unlawful detainer actions in California state courts on behalf of property owners and managers.

LOCATION 309 West 7th St Los Angeles CA US 90014 
Overview
If you want an exciting job with one of the largest off-price retailers in the nation, join the Burlington Stores, Inc. team as a Construction Project Manager! We are on a significant, long-term growth trajectory, with over 800 stores around the country now and many more to come.
Burlington Stores, Inc. is seeking a Construction Project Manager who will manage projects primarily in the Western U.S. territory, flexing as needed. Home base locations that will be considered include Southern California, Arizona, Nevada, Utah, and Colorado. 
This position requires 5-7 years of experience in multi-site retail construction project management, and the ability to travel 75-80% of the time. The successful candidate will have experience with a fast-paced retailer, managing multiple concurrent new store and remodel construction projects.
The Construction Project Manager's responsibilities span a broad spectrum, covering all areas of project management, project planning, cost management, time management, quality management, and contract administration.
Major responsibilities include:

Oversee construction projects from start to finish.
Coordinate the efforts of all parties involved in the project which include the architects, contractors, laborers, procurement.
Monitor the progress of the construction activities on a regular basis and hold regular status meetings with contractor to ensure project delivery according to project-specific schedule.
Maintain strict adherence to budgetary guidelines & quality and safety standards.
Conduct weekly/bi-weekly inspection of construction sites.
Ensure project documents are complete and conform to Burlington standards.
Articulate the roles and responsibilities of the external/internal team members and work with/through others for delivery.

Candidates must have at least a high school diploma, 7-10 years' experience in construction, and 5-7 years in multi-site retail project management. Strong construction knowledge a must. Must be able to travel 75-80% of the time. Proficiency with Microsoft Office programs and web-based applications required. Must be adaptable to learning new technologies as needed.
You will enjoy a competitive wage and comprehensive benefit package, including a generous paid time off plan, a company matched 401(K) and an associate discount. We are a rapidly growing brand, and provide a variety of professional development opportunities so our associates can grow with us. We work hard and have fun together! Burlington associates make a difference in the lives of customers, colleagues, and the communities where we live and work every day. Burlington Stores is an equal opportunity employer committed to workplace diversity.

 We are looking for a Registered Nurse II for the Step Down Unit at St. Jude Medical Center Sign-On Bonus $20,000. 
 Location: Fullerton, CA Work Schedule: Full time - 72 Biweekly Hours Shift: 12-hour, Nights 
 Job Summary: The RN independently uses the nursing process to safely, therapeutically and efficiently care for a group of patients. Uses information from a variety of sources to assess, plan, implement, identify outcomes and evaluate patient's plan of care. 
 The Intermediate care/ Step Down unit is organized, operated and maintained to provide the monitoring and care of patients with moderate or potentially severe physiologic instability requiring specialized equipment and or personnel necessary for invasive monitoring. 
 Essential Functions:

Facilitates patient care through effective communication.
Develops and maintains therapeutic and effective relationships with patient/family and the health care team.
Delegates care appropriately.
Participates in Shared Governance/Participative Leadership.
Demonstrates awareness of unit and service guidelines related to staffing and scheduling.
Intermediate Care/ Step Down Unit (4N-CCU/SDU, 601001-F01): 
 Responsible for the patients in Step down Unit (SDU) requiring step-down level of care. This may include but not limited to respiratory failure, congestive heart failure, drug overdose, sepsis, DKA, GI bleed, Pneumonia, cardiothoracic surgeries, AMI, CVA, vascular surgeries and neurosurgeries. 
 Demonstrates knowledge/ability to use/interpret results of equipment in the area i.e. EKG strips. 
 Appropriately manages the patient with temporary pacemaker. Recognized normal and abnormal functioning, and accurately adjusts the rate, milli-amperage or polarity of a temporary pace maker in accordance with the physicians specific orders. 
 Demonstrates creativity, sensitivity and critical thinking ability in the coordination and provision of patient care, evaluation of care delivery and revision of organizational systems to improve patient outcomes. 
 Supports and fosters strong nursing morale. Maintains a positive professional image of nursing and encourages and recognizes staff for their contributions. 
 Acts as a collaborative resource person whose clinical expertise is actively sought. Encourages and supports the clinical bedside RN in improving their assessment and critical thinking skills. Maintains open lines of communication to address concerns or problems. 
 Promotes a team approach by including the unit RN staff in patient care, communication and disposition. Assures that the coordinator on the unit is involved and is notified of any Rapid Response visitation/consultation. 
 Provides teaching as opportunity permits and the need is identified. 

 Minimum Position Qualifications: 
 Education:

Bachelor's Degree of Nursing, graduate from nursing school (Hired on/after 1/1/11), or
Hired prior to 1/1/11 (and rehired after 1/1/11): Graduate from nursing school with a diploma, Associate Degree, or Bachelor’s Degree in Nursing; or
Hired as a result of a unit transfer from Heritage: Graduate from nursing school with a diploma, Associate Degree, or Bachelor’s Degree in Nursing; or
Hired as a ministry transfer: Currently enrolled in a BSN program with an expected graduation date within 6 months of hire. 

 Experience: One (1) year acute care experience. 
 Licenses and Certifications:

Current CA Registered Nurse License.
American Heart Association BLS Health Care Provider.
Advanced Cardiac Life Support (ACLS) 

 Preferred Position Qualifications: 
 Licenses and Certifications: 

 Professional Nursing Organization Membership 
 CCRN
